title: [Large-scale] Development of Design-Based Teaching Methods to Improve Multilingual Learners' Literacy Awareness

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic literacy skills and experience with job-related language use
context.additional_context: Customized instructional design reflecting multilingual working professionals' literacy learning perceptions, with practical curricula considering real workplace applications

learning_goals: Learners analyze their awareness and self-efficacy during the literacy learning process

In JEDI (justice, equity, diversity, inclusion)-aligned team projects (3â€“5 members), learners will apply role allocation, communication, and conflict resolution strategies to develop an IT solution prototype within two weeks, and complete collaborative problem-solving activities meeting at least four of five JEDI checklist criteria through peer evaluations

Learners will write three types of IT project documents (requirements specifications, test scenarios, etc.) and apply strategic writing skills achieving an average score of 4.0 or higher (5-point scale) in peer evaluations and instructor feedback
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
